citation.article-title: Caldanaerovirga acetigignens gen. nov., sp. nov., an anaerobic xylanolytic, alkalithermophilic bacterium isolated from Trego Hot Spring, Nevada, USA
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Caldanaerovirga acetigignens sp. nov.
Caldanaerovirga acetigignens (a.ce.ti.gig′nens. L. n. acetum vinegar; L. v. gignere to produce; N.L. part. adj. acetigignens vinegar- or acetic acid-producing).
Exhibits the following properties in addition to those given in the genus description.
During exponential growth, cells are straight or slightly bent rods of 0.4–0.8 μm in width and 3–6 μm in length.
Cells from stationary phase are more variable in size and shape, showing a more expressed curved or bent morphology.
Neither flagella or motility nor sporulation are observed.
Cells stain Gram-negative but are phylogenetically Gram-type positive.
Growth with glucose as carbon and energy source occurs between pH25 °C 6.8 and 8.8 (optimum, pH 8.4); no growth occurs after 200 h of incubation at pH 9.0 or above, or at 6.5 or below.
Grows at 44–74 °C (glucose); no growth occurs after 300 h of incubation at 76 °C or above, or at 42 °C or below.
Optimum temperature for growth is around 62 and 66 °C when grown on glucose and xylose, respectively.
The shortest doubling time observed was approximately 4 h (glucose) and 3.4 h (xylose).
Chemo-organotroph.
Positive for utilization of xylose, glucose, mannose, xylan, pyruvate, fructose, ribose, Casamino acids, mannitol, tryptone, peptone, cellobiose and yeast extract.
Acetate (2.2–2.4 mol/glucose) is the major fermentation product when grown with glucose suggesting a homoacetogenic fermentation.
Yeast extract is required for growth.
Does not utilize sucrose, glycine betaine, galactose, lactose, xylitol, sorbitol, inositol, arabinose, starch or cellulose.
Using mineral media containing 1 g yeast extract l−1 as an electron donor, thiosulfate and sulfur, but not sulfate or sulfite, are reduced to sulfide.
Growth occurs in the presence of an atmosphere containing 0.1 % O2 but not 0.2 %.
Positive for acid phosphatase and naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase.
Major PLFAs of strain JW/SA-NV4T are i15 : 0, a15 : 0, 15 : 0 and 16 : 0.
The G+C content of the DNA of the type strain is 38.6 mol%; standard deviation 0.4 (HPLC).
The type strain, JW/SA-NV4T (=DSM 18802T=ATCC BAA-1454T), was isolated from Trego hot spring (4 °46′12″ N 11 °6′46″ W), Black Rock Desert, north-western Nevada, USA.
